properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:42AM EST until January 18 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Driftwood River...Eagle Creek...East Fork White River...Eel River...
Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...Wabash River...White River...
Wildcat Creek...


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 1 and a half inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
The East Fork White River near Rivervale.
* from late Tuesday night to Saturday January 18.
* At  7:30 AM Friday the stage was 11.9 feet.
* Flood stage is 20.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by late Tuesday night and
continue to rise to near 21.7 feet by Thursday afternoon.  It will
fall below flood stage by Saturday January 18.
* At 22.0 feet...A few local county roads begin to flood and are
impassable.  These include Buddha Road south of the gage and
Lawrenceport Road.  All local roads across the East Fork of the
White River are threatened by high water, and some are closed.
Flooding of agricultural lands in Lawrence County is in progress.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
